arm_group.description: the use of unilateral stent insertion in malignant hilar obstruction for using endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography(ERCP)
the use of bilateral stent insertion in malignant hilar obstruction for using endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography(ERCP)

brief_summary.textblock:
Internal biliary drainage is an useful method for a control of jaundice and cholangitis to
      patients who had a malignant hilar obstruction due to hepatocellular carcinoma,
      cholangiocarcinoma, gall bladder cancer or metastatic lymphadenopathy.

      Bilateral biliary drainage is more physiologic but technically difficult to compared with
      unilateral biliary drainage specially related to conformability and flexibility between
      using stents.

      There are no prospective clinical trials compared with these internal biliary drainage
      methods in hilar malignant obstruction using metal stent.

      Therefore, the investigators want to compare the clinical outcome of two method: Unilateral
      biliary stent and Bilateral biliary stent

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison Between Unilateral Versus Bilateral Stenting for Malignant Hilar Biliary Obstruction to Use a LCD Stent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age> 18

          -  diagnosis of malignancy in pathology or cytology

          -  jaundice(Total bilirubin)> 2.0 mg/dL

          -  Diagnosed malignant hilar invasion to CT or other image finding

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  bleeding tendency(INR>1.5)

          -  Pregnancy

          -  severe liver,kidney disease

intervention.description: to use a LCD stent at an unilateral or bilateral stent insertion
intervention.other_name: Niti-S large cell D-type biliary stent [LCD]

intervention.description: to use ERCP for a stent insertion in an obstructive biliary tract

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Between Unilateral Versus Bilateral Stenting for Malignant Hilar Biliary Obstruction to Use a Large Cell Niti-S (LCD) Stent

other_outcome.description: Participants will followed after stent insertion and observe a complication rate between two groups.

overall_official.affiliation: Division of Gastroenterology,Department of internal medicaion,samsung medical center,Sungkyunkwan University School of Medicine

primary_outcome.description: Participants will followed for the new obstruction(new jaundice) will occur.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
